checkpoint.name: Post operative notes and orders are recorded

checkpoint.name: Appropriate suture material is used for surgery as per requirement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for what kind of sutures used for different surgeries . Braided Biological sutures are not used for dirty wounds, Catgut is not used for closing fascial layers of abdominal wounds or where prolonged support is required

checkpoint.name: Check for suturing techniques are applied as per protocol
Adequate Haemostasis is secaud during surgery
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for Cautery and suture legation practices

checkpoint.name: Surgical Safety Check List is used for each surgery
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for Surgical safety check list has been used for surgical procedures

checkpoint.name: Sponge and Instrument Count Practice is implemented
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Instrument, needles and sponges are counted before beginning of case, before final closure and on completing of procedure

checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Notice in local language is displayed at entrance of X ray department asking every female to inform radiographer/radiologist whether she is likely to be pregnant

checkpoint.name:
The client is given full information about optimal pregnancy spacing and
the benefits of it as a part of FP health education and counselling.

The importance of timely initiation of an FP method after childbirth, miscarriage,
or abortion will be emphasized.

checkpoint.name: Client is counselled about the options for family planning available
The client is informed that condoms prevent sexually transmitted infections (STIs) & HIV

IUD insertion is done as per standard protocol

checkpoint.name: Post test counselling given as per protocol
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
window period, a repeat test is recommended, clients with suspected tuberculosis are referred to the nearest microscopy centre. In case of a positive test result, the counsellor assists the client to understand the 
implications of the positive test result and helps in coping with the test result. The 
counsellor also ensures access to treatment and care, and supports disclosure of the HIV 
status to the spouse.

checkpoint.name: Pre Test Counselling is done as per protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
basic information and benefits of HIV testing
potential risks such as discrimination. The client is also informed about their right to refuse, follow-up services . Pregnant
women are given additional information on nutrition, hygiene, the importance of an
institutional delivery and HIV testing so as to avoid HIV transmission from mother to child.
